text: The 2018–19 New Zealand Football Championship season (currently known as the ISPS Handa Premiership for sponsorship reasons) was the fifteenth season of the NZFC since its establishment in 2004. Ten teams competed in the competition with Auckland City and Team Wellington representing the ISPS Handa Premiership in the 2019 OFC Champions League after finishing Champions and Premiers (Auckland City) and runner-up (Team Wellington) respectively in the 2017–18 competition. ==Clubs== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align: left;" |- !width=175|Team !!Location !!Stadium !!Capacity !!Manager !!Kit manufacturer !!Shirt sponsor |- |Auckland City ||Auckland ||Kiwitea Street ||align=center|3,250 || Ramon Tribulietx ||Kappa || Trillian Trust Inc (Front) Carters (Back) |- |Canterbury United ||Christchurch ||English Park ||align=center|9,000 || Willy Gerdsen ||Nike ||Robbie's Bar and Bistro |- |Eastern Suburbs ||Auckland ||Riverhills Park ||align=center|5,000 || Danny Hay ||Lilywhites ||Winger Motors |- |Hamilton Wanderers ||Hamilton ||Porritt Stadium ||align=center|5,000 || Ricki Herbert ||Kelme ||The Soccer Shop |- |Hawke's Bay United ||Napier ||Bluewater Stadium ||align=center|5,000 || Brett Angell ||Adidas ||Thirsty Whale |- |Southern United ||Dunedin ||Sunnyvale Park ||align=center|1,000 || Paul O'Reilly||Lotto Sport Italia ||Freshwater Solutions |- |Tasman United ||Nelson ||Trafalgar Park ||align=center|18,000 || Andy Hedge ||Nike||Nelson Pine LVL (Front) Sprig & Fern (Back) |- |Team Wellington ||Wellington ||David Farrington Park ||align=center|2,250 || José Figueira||Nike ||Stonewood Homes |- |Waitakere United ||Auckland ||The Trusts Arena ||align=center|4,900 || Chris Milicich || Lotto Sport Italia || Mitre 10 Mega - Henderson (Front) Heritage Hotels (Back) |- |Wellington Phoenix ||Wellington ||Porirua Park ||align=center|1,900 || Paul Temple ||Adidas ||Huawei |} ==Regular season== ===League table=== ===Positions by round=== Notes: * The match between Southern United and Auckland City in Round 3 was abandoned at 0–0 after 47 minutes due to the pitch becoming unplayable, it will be rescheduled for 14 February 2019. * Waitakere United were tied with Wellington Phoenix Reserves at the end of Round 3 in last place. * The match between Canterbury United and Tasman United was cancelled due to the Christchurch mosque shootings and awarded as a 0–0 draw. ===Fixtures and results=== The 2018–19 season sees every team play the other both home and away.
